subclusters.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
Immunosenescence via Replicative and Stress-Induced T Cell Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA damage response (DDR) triggering senescence and accumulation of senescent cells via persistent DNA damage, independent of telomere shortening.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence in vascular smooth muscle cells driven by DNA damage and DDR pathways leading to senescence and SASP in atherosclerosis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes DDR, genome instability, mitochondrial dysfunction, and epigenetic alterations as drivers of senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights permanent cell cycle arrest via tumor suppressors RB and p53 in response to DNA damage and other stresses inducing senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers replicative and stress-induced senescence driven by DNA damage and telomere shortening, with SASP and cell cycle regulators.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DDR in neurons leading to senescence-like state, linking DNA damage, cell cycle arrest, and neuroinflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes miR-96-5p induction causing senescence via epigenetic regulation of DDR-related senescence effectors.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence caused by telomere shortening triggering DDR and senescence accumulation impairing tissue function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on premature senescence induced by environmental and physiological stressors distinct from replicative senescence, with SASP effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress-induced premature senescence independent of telomere shortening, involving cell cycle checkpoint activation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights accumulation of senescent cells with pro-inflammatory SASP driving tissue dysfunction and aging-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cell accumulation, markers, dual roles, and senolytic interventions including exercise to reduce senescent burden.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on cell cycle arrest from diverse stressors, SASP secretion, senescent cell persistence, and pro-survival pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes senescence as stable arrest with SASP, dual roles in aging and pathology, and changes in cell identity and function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence as causal driver with SASP and apoptotic resistance promoting aging and tissue dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cell accumulation, SASP-mediated inflammation, and causal role in organismal aging with senolytic benefits.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on secretion of microvesicular miRNAs as part of SASP contributing to aging and tissue dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cells as causal drivers of aging via SASP, with rejuvenation strategies targeting senescent cell depletion.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cell accumulation, SASP secretion, immune surveillance decline, and immune evasion promoting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links senescence accumulation and SASP to accelerated aging in preeclampsia, with persistent pro-inflammatory markers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) and SASP Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence induced by proteinopathies in Alzheimer’s disease, chronic SASP-driven inflammation, and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immunosenescence via Replicative and Stress-Induced T Cell Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on T cell replicative senescence, clonal exhaustion, loss of costimulatory molecules, and apoptosis contributing to immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immunosenescence via Replicative and Stress-Induced T Cell Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replicative senescence of CD8+ T cells with NK marker expression, apoptosis resistance, and functional decline in aging immunity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immunosenescence via Replicative and Stress-Induced T Cell Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details chronic antigenic stress driving T cell senescence, altered gene expression, dysregulated signaling, and proinflammatory phenotype.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence Interaction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related autophagy decline impairing cellular homeostasis, promoting accumulation of damaged components that induce senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitotic Misregulation and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes aging driven by mitotic machinery dysfunction causing chromosomal instability and gene misregulation linked to senescence phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromatin Reconfiguration and Nuclear Architecture in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes lamin B1 depletion triggering large-scale chromatin remodeling that regulates senescence gene expression and SASP.
